pages.body:
Here is what I did for my headless Ubuntu 19.04 server.

## Install TOR to enable functionality with zeronet.  [Source](https://www.linuxuprising.com/2018/10/how-to-install-and-use-tor-as-proxy-in.html)

 - Start by installing apt-transport-https, needed in order to use https repositories, and curl, to download the repository key:

`sudo apt install tor tor-geoipdb torsocks`

### Prepare TOR to work with Zeronet,  [Source](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq/#how-to-use-zeronet-with-tor)

 - Open up your /etc/tor/torrc file with

`sudo nano /etc/tor/torrc`

 - Remove the # character from lines `ControlPort 9051` and `CookieAuthentication 1` (line ~57)
    
 - Restart tor, then add permission for yourself to read the auth cookie. With Debian Linux, 

`sudo usermod -a -G debian-tor [yourlinuxuser]`

(be sure to replace [yourlinuxuser] appropriately.)
 - Logout/Login with your user to apply group changes

Tip: You can verify if your Tor setup is running correctly using
`echo 'PROTOCOLINFO' | nc 127.0.0.1 9051`

### Install Zeronet for Debian Linux,  [Source](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/tree/py3#other-platforms-install-from-source)

`sudo apt-get update`

`wget https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet-linux/archive/dist-linux64/ZeroNet-py3-linux64.tar.gz`

`tar xvpfz ZeroNet-py3-linux64.tar.gz`
	
### Enable the Bootstrapper and UIPassword plugins and launch Zeronet

`cd ZeroNet-linux-dist-linux64/`

`cd core`

`cd plugins`

`mv disabled-UiPassword UiPassword`

`mv disabled-Bootstrapper Bootstrapper`

`mv Trayicon disabled-Trayicon`

`cd ..`

`cd ..`

`nohup ./ZeroNet.sh --ui_ip '*' --ui_port 80 --ui_password mypassword`

 - Now you can close your terminal and open your browser to the ip address of your server to see the WebUI.

Notes: 
(ui_ip tells the client to bind the UI to any ip)
(ui_port) being set to 80 is the default port for your browser, you can change it but then you will need to specify the port with the address such as `http://ServerIP:43110` with 43110 being the identified port for the WebUI
(ui_password) this is the password used for your WebUI

## Happy ZeroBoxing!

The Copyright Wall-Of-Shame === Let this serve as a reminder, that for the 9 out of 10 times the people who make a fuss about morality and ethics, are the same people who don't abide by them, and actually do worse things. This number increases to 10 out of 10 times with anti-piracy collectives, as they have been observed and proven in these past few years of the following. 01. The small journalism site Torrentfreak.com receiving a [total of 11 false DMCA take down notices](https://torrentfreak.com/all-dmca-notices-filed-against-torrentfreak-in-2019-were-bogus-191231/) throughout the year of 2019 that targeted various articles for a variety of non-infringing reasons. And while the articles are still accessible, their web presence on Search sites have been down ranked regardless of the take down claim validity causing real damage to small struggling creators. 01. The adult entertainment company Strike 3 Holdings attempting to cleverly request subpoenas against ISPs to identify the internet account owner [by submitting their cases to a Florida State court](https://torrentfreak.com/copyright-troll-back-in-federal-court-after-it-fails-to-save-judicial-resources/) in an attempt to bypass the federal judicial requirements for copyright related cases which not only sparked a backlash from other legal scholars. 01. The American Petroleum Institute being granted a DMCA subpoena [demanding Cloudflare to terminate the accounts and expose the personal details](https://torrentfreak.com/american-petroleum-institute-obtains-dmca-subpoena-ordering-cloudflare-action-against-pirate-site-191222/) of any individuals behind several domains that offered copies of its standards. Claiming the documents are being distributed without their permission and can only be done so in physical form. While the public has a tremendous interest in the petroleum industry's operations as it affects the economy, our safety, and daily lives in innumerable ways leaving to the he standards should be open to inspection. 01. [A Thai police chief and a 'fake copyright agent' being caught extort the parents of a 15 year old Thiland girl](https://torrentfreak.com/copyright-sting-targeting-15-year-old-backfires-with-arrest-warrant-big-sales-191112/) after the girl was instructed to create cartoon faces on baskets after receiving an order for 136 krathong floats only to result in public outcry and the issuing of an arrest warren for the 'fake copyright agent' but no consequence for the police chief who received a portion of the settlement funds from the various of victims. 01. [NBC-Universal making multiple attempts to remove BitTorrent.com from Google search](https://torrentfreak.com/nbcuniversal-repeatedly-flags-bittorrent-com-as-a-pirate-site-190223/) by sending 293 out of the 387 total copyright infringement notices that target the domain. While fortunately for BitTorrent Inc, their domain has not suffered from any down ranking as a result of the false claims, but demonstrates Google's favouritism relating to the intellectual property of mainstream corporations, when it concerns inaccurate, false, and misleading rampant copyright claims, in comparison to independent creators who are given little concern nor representation. 01. UK-based music company De Wolfe Music, using the content monetisation company AdRev Publishing, [to issue a takedown notice against a video that used a music piece from the public domain](https://torrentfreak.com/kenyan-govt-protests-as-national-anthem-hit-with-youtube-copyright-complaint-190206/), titled, ‘Ee Mungu Nguvu Yetu’ (‘O God, of all Creation’)), which was written by the Kenyan Anthem Commission in 1963, to serve as the state anthem. 01. Multiple YouTubers who are expressing their concern that they are receiving copyright strikes for [providing audio clips](https://torrentfreak.com/youtubes-copyright-mess-is-stifling-music-education-190403/) generated that were generated from a midi file or, using [Sport clips](https://torrentfreak.com/youtuber-sends-lawyer-after-ufc-to-stop-unfair-takedown-notices-190517/) within a piece of commentary. Resulting in a response from Youtube that would see the company [forbidding take down claims on short audio clips](https://torrentfreak.com/youtube-forbids-monetizing-short-music-clips-through-manual-content-id-claims-100816/), and even bringing [litigation against a Youtube extortionist](https://torrentfreak.com/youtube-sues-alleged-scammer-over-dmca-extortion-scheme-190920/). 01. Three copyright enforcement lawyers from the Johan Schlüter law firm were [caught swindling almost $16 million, from the MPAA and other Rights holders](https://torrentfreak.com/anti-piracy-lawyers-sentenced-to-years-in-prison-for-defrauding-copyright-holders-180612/) while being employed by the Danish anti-piracy group Antipiratgruppen. And while the trio was ordered to serve prison sentencing which ranged from two to five years, there was the added irony of the trio being free to resume their practice of law upon their release without any additional deterrence. 01. Swedish ISP Bahnhof calling into question [the validity of Swedish judges who have ruled favorable on copyright cases](https://torrentfreak.com/isp-questions-impartiality-of-judges-in-copyright-troll-cases-180602/) while possessing a conflict of interests by maintaining their corporate relations. 01. Adobe [refusing to pay the licensing fees on the sales of their products that contained property of Dolby Laboratories](https://torrentfreak.com/dolby-labs-sues-adobe-for-copyright-infringement-180314/) while also avoiding any requested sales audits after multiple years. As to be expected, the most profitable companies, that will viciously protect their intellectual property at all costs, will also conveniently ignore the same copyright laws when it suits their own benefit and agenda. 01. Copyright enthusiast David Lowery casting criticism at professor Michael Geist over the importance of copyright acknowledgement all [while failing to obtain the proper license on an image shared in his Blog post](https://torrentfreak.com/when-a-pro-copyright-rant-goes-wrong-180225/). All while ignoring the research that has discovered that [many Harvard Lawyers believe that some levels of copyright infringement are ethically acceptable](https://torrentfreak.com/piracy-is-ethically-acceptable-for-many-harvard-lawyers-research-finds-190607/). 01. FlightSimLabs being caught [planting a security exploit named ‘SecurityXploded.Com's ChromePasswordDump v5.5’ into their software](https://torrentfreak.com/flight-sim-company-embeds-malware-to-steal-pirates-passwords-180219/) , which would successfully capture and transmit back to the developer, the stored login credentials of Google Chrome users who were programmatically determined to be using an illegal copy of their software. While this act demonstrated the developers negligent concern towards the security of users in general. it highlights that little consideration was given to the many instances that these browsers would often have stored credentials of family wide households. Preemptively punishing innocent parties as unnamed victims. 01. The company behind the 2015 drama film titled 'Fathers & Daughters' [having their copyright infringement case being dismissed](https://torrentfreak.com/judge-tells-movie-company-that-it-cant-sue-alleged-bittorrent-pirate-180118/) due to the company's exclusive right of ownership to the movie being sold to a company called Vertical Entertainment who were not part of the lawsuit. 01. YouTube allowing multiple RIAA members to claim & monetize videos that contained nothing but [white static noise.](https://torrentfreak.com/musicians-white-noise-youtube-video-hit-with-copyright-complaints-180105/), [a cat's pur](https://torrentfreak.com/youtube-flags-cat-purring-as-copyright-infringing-music-150211/), the [sounds of rainfall](https://torrentfreak.com/youtubes-copyright-protection-system-is-a-total-mess-can-it-be-fixed-181222/), and even a [five minute clip of JFK’s famous “The President and the Press” speech](https://torrentfreak.com/music-distributor-claims-right-to-monetize-jfk-speech-140511/). Illustrating that copyright is fundamentally broken and is only suitable to benefit a very select privileged few. 01. Music copyright advocates using the DMCA and domain seizures to cause irreparable harm to mash up sites like [Sowndhaus](https://torrentfreak.com/could-a-single-copyright-complaint-kill-your-domain-171203/) & [Spinrilla](https://torrentfreak.com/riaa-labels-sue-hip-hop-mixtape-download-site-spinrilla-170206/) by taking action of litigation without ever notifying the website owners of the [claim of infringement](https://torrentfreak.com/piracy-riaa-labels-asked-us-to-promote-their-music-spinrilla-says-170316/). 01. Epic Games' [taking aggressive judicial action against a 14 year old Fortnite cheater](https://torrentfreak.com/mom-defends-14-year-old-fortnite-cheater-in-court-171125/) over the usage of an online game cheat and multiple free accounts registered with fake email addresses with claims of copyright infringement as their means of halting cheaters. Demonstrating that copyright litigation is often the litigious tool of choice with [little consideration for those](https://torrentfreak.com/cheating-fortnite-kid-wants-copyright-lawsuit-dismissed-190807/) who may be targeted. 01. ABC, AOL, CBS Broadcasting, NBCUniversal, NPR, Time, Viacom, Warner Bros, Yahoo and Ziff Davi [settling with numerous photographers due to infringing use of their photographs](https://torrentfreak.com/pirating-mainstream-media-outlets-haunted-by-photographers-in-court-171028/) found throughout their News & Blog articles. In which CBS later [counter sue due to a Gunsmoke screen shot being posted on social media](https://torrentfreak.com/cbs-sues-man-for-posting-image-of-a-59-year-tv-show-on-social-media-171030/) in an attempt to reduce their damage settlement. Demonstrating that not even those who actively litigate copyright law don't bare any respect for it. 01. New Zealand's ruling National Party being [forced to pay $600k for infringing the copyrights of Eminem's track "Lose Yourself" due to using a derivative song with a similar melody for their campaign ad](https://torrentfreak.com/lose-yourself-national-party-guilty-of-eminem-copyright-infringement-171025/) demonstrating that even when obtaining proper licenses will not prevent a copyright related lawsuit. 01. Four officials of the Russian site-blocking body [Rozcomnadzor, {including spokesman, top lawyer, and Anastasiya Zvyagintseva} being charged with fraud](https://torrentfreak.com/russian-site-blocking-chiefs-under-investigation-for-fraud-171024/) and stand accused of having 'employed' ghost staff whose salaries were actually paid to existing employees, on top of their own money all while being allowed to block 4,000 sites on copyright grounds with an additional 41,000 innocent websites blocked as collateral damage demonstrating that copyright law often leaves a trail of harm rather than any potential good. 01. Game developer [Atlus targeting the Patreon page of the RPCS3 {Playstation 3} emulator with a DMCA takedown notice](https://torrentfreak.com/of-course-atlus-hit-rpcs3s-patreon-page-over-persona-5-170927/) due to a comment which stated that Atlus' game title Persona 5 will be compatible with the RPCS3 emulator, which resulted in an intimidation tactic that persuaded the RPCS3 development team to remove all occurrences of the compatibility reference from their Patreon and other pages while Atlus admits that the RPCS3 team has done nothing wrong nor infringed on any of their rights. Illustrating that abusive claims of copyright infringement are often made without hesitance. 01. Sega attempting to trick Steam users [by sneaking Denuvo into their Sonic Mania release by not specifying the third party DRM EULA on the store front page](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/sonic-mania-pcs-drm-angers-players-sega-adds-offli/1100-6452993/) while the game was on pre-order and also handing out [a 'free' emulated Sonic the Hedgehog Sega Genesis/Mega Drive game](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/four-days-before-release-sonic-mania-pc-delayed-bu/1100-6452474/) to hinder the [issuance of refunds](http://store.steampowered.com/steam_refunds). 01. Media giant [ABS-CBN using the judiciary favor of a Florida Federal court to establish a $1.8 million dollar settlement from the operator of KissAsian,ch who is likely not a US citizen.](https://torrentfreak.com/florida-court-orders-pirate-site-kissasian-to-pay-1-8m-in-damages-170825/) Allowing much needed US resources to be devoted to foreign parties regarding their foreign affairs. 01. The [RIAA refusing to give accreditation to their musical artists and piece composers](https://torrentfreak.com/riaa-says-artists-dont-need-moral-rights-artists-disagree-170521/) with the refusal reason of ['it would be "complex" to always attribute writers for their work".](https://torrentfreak.com/artists-protest-riaa-for-trampling-on-their-moral-rights-170817/) 01. Flava Works [attempting to extort huge sums of cash {$97,000 – $525,000} from WE,tv's President & General Manager Marc Juris with threats of exposing his sexual preference to the public](https://torrentfreak.com/public-figure-threatened-with-exposure-over-gay-piracy-fine-170817/) in the event of failure to pay. Which, once again, illustrating that copyright enforcers are often worse than the most hardened of criminals. 01. The Anti-Ad-Blocking company [Admiral submitting a DMCA removal notice to the EasyList {ad-blocker definition} Github repository with the goal of having the Ad Server URl entry 'functionalclam.com^$third-party' removed from the list.](https://torrentfreak.com/dmca-used-to-remove-ad-server-url-from-easylist-ad-blocklist-170811/) Creating a slippery slope for future removals. 01. Copyright extortionists manipulation of the courts, led by Kerry Culpeppe and using intimidation tactics to accuse a [72 year old man](https://torrentfreak.com/72-year-old-man-accused-of-pirating-over-a-thousand-torrents-170810/), a [Texan woman](https://torrentfreak.com/copyright-troll-claims-texan-woman-downloaded-over-54000-torrents-170713/), and [others](https://torrentfreak.com/86-year-old-grandma-accused-of-pirating-a-zombie-game-161031/) of mass infringement. 01. Telecom giant's Dish Network, Bell Canada, TVA, Videotron, and Rogers abuse of the judicial system with the goals of [shutting down TVAddons and intimidating Canadian resident Adam Lackman by allowing private agencies to seize control of the platform and equipment](https://torrentfreak.com/tvaddons-returns-ugly-war-canadian-telcos-kodi-addons-170801/) without any chance of legal representation or any real sense of justice or due process for the site operator. {Those who wish to show support can do so [[here](https://www.generosity.com/community-fundraising/tvaddons-legal-defense-fund)]} 01. The [RIAA making attempts to bring litigation against Cloudflare concerning numerous MP3Skull domains in an attempt to illustrate to the courts that Cloudflare is facilitating the activities of controversial sites](https://torrentfreak.com/cloudflare-asks-court-to-vacate-moot-pirate-site-blocking-order-170724/), regardless that the domains were owned by Sony Music Entertainment, who is an RIAA member. 01. [The Daily Mail willfully infringing copyrights and using unlicensed viral YouTube videos to promote their articles](https://torrentfreak.com/daily-mail-sued-for-pirating-dozens-of-viral-videos-170711/). Highlighting that companies will ignore the copyrights of others when there is a financial return. 01. The US State Department, MPAA, and RIAA [asking Stanford University students to propagate a fake Twitter feud in an attempt to facilitate these agencies anti-piracy goals](https://torrentfreak.com/state-dept-mpaa-riaa-fake-twitter-feud-plan-backfires-170706/#disqus_thread) and using Benjamin Franklin, who conversely was an advocate of sharing, as their reference. 01. [The Premier League carelessly making attempts to remove Facebook.com from Google search](https://torrentfreak.com/premier-league-asks-google-to-take-down-facebooks-homepage-170429/) on the accusations of facilitating the infringement of their intellectual property, which should give grave concern over the recent [Notice-&-Staydown](https://torrentfreak.com/takedown-staydown-would-be-a-disaster-internet-archive-warns-160607/) proposals. 01. The [AEPI being caught swindling over 42.5 million euros from artists while top executives payed themselves over nearly five million euros between them](https://torrentfreak.com/huge-scandal-engulfs-greek-anti-piracy-royalties-group-170318/). After receiving a fine of 35 million euros, 7.5 million euros is left uncounted and leaving the orchestrator's of such schemes unaccountable. 01. The BPI having to [dismiss PIPCU's Management Board member David Wood {who played a key role in Operation Creative} on the grounds of gross misappropriation of funds and referring him to the Metropolitan Police only to file for bankruptcy after years of excessive financial influence](https://torrentfreak.com/police-investigate-former-bpi-anti-piracy-chief-pipcu-board-member-170317/), which further illustrating that those with positions of power typically commit the most severe crimes. 01. USTR Special 301 Report singling out countries, regardless of the country's numerous intellectual property enforcement measures. Leaving[Canada](https://torrentfreak.com/canada-rejects-flawed-and-one-sided-piracy-claims-from-us-govt-170310/) and [China](https://torrentfreak.com/china-seriously-doubts-objectivity-of-us-pirate-site-list-180120/) little choice but to disregard the list, describing it as "little more than a lobbying document and the content largely reflects biased submissions from lobby groups." 01. PIPCU facilitating the arrest of Callum Haywood & the seizure of his censorship circumvention proxies [only to have his charges dismissed two years later due to conflicting arguments by the prosecution.](https://torrentfreak.com/uk-court-dismisses-case-against-torrent-site-proxy-operator-170307/) {Illustrating that PIPCU and other law enforcement agencies are willing to cause real harm while operating on the sole interests of their donors regardless of any technological legality or relevant innocence.} 01. Google having to [submit a formal report to the U.S. Copyright Office which explained that 99.95% of the DMCA notices Google received in one month were bogus and didn't reference any valid links](https://torrentfreak.com/google-99-95-of-recent-trusted-dmca-notices-were-bogus-170222/). Which illustrates rightsholders lack of respect for the DMCA take-down systems that copyright advocates constantly label ineffective, while [demonstrating that any tool granted will be ineffective](https://torrentfreak.com/music-industry-wants-piracy-filters-no-takedown-whack-a-mole-170222/) due to the incompetence of the user. 01. A Seattle District Court judge [Ricardo Martinez, having to introduce a newly conceived method of handing the default judgments demands of copyright advocates](https://torrentfreak.com/judge-splits-750-piracy-penalty-between-bittorrent-peers-170217/) by splitting the minimal allowed sum between all accused parties which resulting in a fine of a few hundred instead of the thousands that rightsholder demand as their compensation for loss. 01. The creators of Denuvo, [carelessly securing their website resulting in an intelligence leak](https://torrentfreak.com/crackers-swarm-as-denuvo-website-leaks-secret-information-170205/) while advocating how secure their anti-tamper technology is. Only to later [encourage the removal of the Cracking Timeline History Of Denuvo section from Wikipedia.](https://torrentfreak.com/controversial-wikipedia-edits-wipe-out-denuvo-crack-history-190502/) 01. French tax authorities accusing VideoLAN of having financial ties to a torrent website named Torrent9, [on the basis that the torrent site's help section offering a link and recommendations to VideoLAN's VLC Media Player](https://torrentfreak.com/tax-authority-grills-vlc-player-over-link-from-a-torrent-site-170130/). While the accusation was later retracted due to public protest, the act highlights the misconceived ideology of those who have enforcement powers. 01. Casey Tebo [attempting a publicity stunt](https://torrentfreak.com/after-pirate-shoplifting-stunt-movie-director-speaks-out-170122/) by pretending to steal clam chowder ingredients from a supermarket [ in an attempt to prove a point relating to copyright infringement](https://torrentfreak.com/movie-director-steals-clam-chowder-to-avenge-illegal-downloads-170119/) in an effort to spread awareness of his film. 01. Finding two principals of Prenda Law guilty of the charges of conspiracy to commit fraud, money laundering, and perjury by a Minnesota District Court of law, demonstrating acknowledgement by the U.S. Government who accuses Prenda principals [John Steele and Paul Hansmeier](https://torrentfreak.com/prenda-copyright-trolls-arrested-and-charged-with-fraud-and-extortion-161216/) of running a multimillion-dollar fraud and extortion operation which eventually [led to their disbarrment in an Illinois Supreme Court](https://torrentfreak.com/copyright-troll-attorney-john-steele-disbarred-by-illinois-supreme-court-170522/) while [later being convicted and sentenced to over ten years in prison](https://torrentfreak.com/copyright-troll-lawyer-sentenced-to-14-years-in-prison-190614/). 01. Having to force an [Oregan Judge to deny Voltage Pictures legal expense demands of $17,348l](https://torrentfreak.com/court-protects-bittorrent-pirate-from-overaggressive-filmmakers-161214/) due to an original agreed settlement amount of $750 plus reasonable attorney fees. Showing that a copyright advocate believes an entire bill sum is a 'reasonable' amount only later to be forced to [pay a similar amount](https://torrentfreak.com/court-protects-bittorrent-pirate-from-overaggressive-filmmakers-161214/) to the defendants. 01. The Hamburg Regional Court [expecting anyone who shares a link must have preemptive knowledge if the linked material is infringing or not](https://torrentfreak.com/unknowingly-linking-to-infringing-content-is-still-infringement-court-rules-161210/) and are required to properly attribute it's license, if any exist. Expressing that a lack of knowledge of infringement does not equal innocence. 01. Voltage Pictures [and friends](http://www.imdb.com/title/tt3203616/companycredits?ref_=tt_dt_co) being found guilty of wrongfully accusing others of copyright infringement and [having to compensate their legal expenses](https://torrentfreak.com/court-falsely-accused-movie-pirate-deserves-17k-compensation-161206/), while others who can't afford a proper defense susceptible to legal threats and intimidation regardless of any factual proof of innocence or guilt.. 01. The [ever growing increase](https://www.startpage.com/do/search?q=host%3Atorrentfreak.com+%2BCarnegie%2BMellon%2BUniversity) of [bias, rights holder sponsored research](https://torrentfreak.com/mpaa-pays-university-for-piracy-research-141118/) generated from educational institutions such as [Carnegie Mellon University, with an end goal of influencing politicians and lawmakers](https://torrentfreak.com/free-tv-show-streaming-hurts-online-sales-research-finds-161201/) to favor the goals of mainstream copyright advocates. 01. Forcing game enthusiasts to wait through endless hours of loading screens due to [an overly broad patent on loading-screen mini-games](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2015/12/loading-screen-game-patent-finally-expires), which also illustrates the lack of motivation for content creators to challenge such vague patents in the pursuit of their own product enrichment, preventing the advancements of innovation. 01. Topdawg Entertainment Inc., Interscope Records, and Universal Music Group [being found guilty of wrongfully censoring](https://torrentfreak.com/court-awards-damages-following-bogus-dmca-takedowns-161130/) Jonathan Emile's music track from YouTube, iTunes and Soundcloud. 01. The CEO of anti-piracy outfit MarkScan [being arrested for masquerading as their competing anti-piracy firm Aiplex](https://torrentfreak.com/anti-piracy-outfit-impersonates-competitor-steals-its-clients-161116/), in an attempt to lure the clients of their competition. Demonstrating how copyright advocates believe that common law doesn't apply to them. 01. Movie chief Graham Burke comparing the actions of file-sharing site [administrators to the examples of a heroin dealer](https://torrentfreak.com/pirate-site-operators-like-heroin-dealers-movie-boss-says-161010/) in an attempt to please his investors. 01. Estonian Theatrical Distribution [using wildcard search-bots to identify and send DMCA take-down notices](https://torrentfreak.com/trolls-try-to-censor-torrentfreaks-copyright-trolls-coverage-161113/) in an attempt to remove News articles that has the word "Trolls" in the title from search engines, demonstrating a lack of concern from these enforcement outfits. 01. The US Navy and other military branches being active participates in mass infringement regarding military software having been sued by [Microsoft](https://torrentfreak.com/u-s-army-base-runs-unlicensed-windows-7-computers-131222/), [Bitmanagement](https://torrentfreak.com/u-s-navy-under-fire-in-mass-software-piracy-lawsuit-180312/), [ Apptricity](https://torrentfreak.com/u-s-caught-pirating-military-software-pays-50-million-to-settle-131127/), while the [MPAA worries about soldiers pirating in Iraq](https://torrentfreak.com/mpaa-worries-about-pirating-u-s-soldiers-in-iraq-100515/), only for the US government to then go on and [give other agencies our 'anti-piracy' skills](https://torrentfreak.com/us-government-teaches-anti-piracy-skills-around-the-globe-171217/). 01. Russian anti-piracy executive [Maxim Ryabyko being arrested for fraud](https://torrentfreak.com/russian-anti-piracy-chief-arrested-fraud-investigation-161007/) after getting caught offering a $800k settlement to Russian file-sharing site Lib{.}rus{.}ec to make charges of infringement simply 'go away'. 01. Anti-Piracy Outfits like NBC Universal [fabricating links](https://torrentfreak.com/anti-piracy-outfits-caught-fabricating-takedown-notices-160918/) in an attempt to show piracy as being a larger problem than it really is. 01. [HBO, Paramount Pictures,](https://torrentfreak.com/fail-anti-piracy-outfits-send-takedown-request-for-non-existent-torrents-160821/) [Publisher Penguin Random House, Digimarc, Sony Music, Dreamroom Productions, Taylor & Francis Group, The University of Chicago Press](https://torrentfreak.com/copyright-holders-keep-targeting-dead-torrent-sites-170611/#disqus_thread), and others sending multiple DMCA notices for links that don't exist in an attempt to show how allegedly ineffective the DMCA is. 01. Rights enforcement outfit Copyright UNIVERSAL going on a [censorship rampage](https://torrentfreak.com/anti-piracy-group-wants-to-take-down-the-internet-160604/) and attempting to censor anything that crosses their path. 01. FOX using a game clip video from YouTube in a Family Guy episode, and then [claiming it as their own and DMCA'ing the original](https://torrentfreak.com/fox-stole-a-game-clip-used-it-in-family-guy-dmcad-the-original-160520/) video. 01. The MPAA's chief saying: "I’m proud to say that the state of our industry has never been stronger.... To paraphrase Mark Twain, [the death of the movies has been greatly exaggerated.](https://torrentfreak.com/piracy-fails-to-prevent-box-office-record-160413/)” the former US Senator, MPAA chairman and CEO Chris Dodd said." 01. # Welcome to ZeroWiki

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform that has been built for the [[ZeroNet]] network.  This wiki is a public, decentralized, and [[cloning|clonable]] site that can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, and sharing knowledge through the creation of [[FAQ]]s, Tutorials, and other documentations. 

You can view the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works, or practice some of your [[markdown]] formatting skills on the Wiki's [[sandbox]] page.

```
File-Sharing sites
=======
Below is a collection of the various file-sharing sites found around ZeroNet. If you don't see one listed here please add it.

__NOTE__: If you intend to share files, please [[pin]] the file so that your zeronet client will not automatically remove it over time.


**Books :**
   * [AntiLibrary](/Antilibrary.bit/): Book catalogs that are separated by languages.
   * [ZeroPub](/zeropub.bit/)
   * [zbookdb](/zbookdb.bit/): A small site that releases five ebooks every week.


**Files :**
   * [BinChan's 0-Share](/1Dphm8Mth9WYN9fPm1yxj8Y4WhcKRhYXJJ/): Similar to ZeroUP.
   * [Intergalactic File Server ](/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er): IFS is a site that allows users to share a wide varity of files. Can also use IFServer.bit
   * [ZeroUP](/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/): File hosting with a file type and size restriction (10MB - 200MB) (popular)
   * [ZeroUP Unlimited](/1CiXRY9ATZSoZqBzwMfXEMsKtPRt2aQoF2/): ZeroUP clone that allows files up to 1GB.

**Important Files :**
   * [Manually Maintained Directories](/15Pf9VVuDT8NSWj1qUBh4V89yPmrmzRw6a/)

**Magnet Links :**
   * [Box-HD](/BoxHD.bit): HD TV Series Box Sets delivered in a 'Play' style UI
   * [KickAssTorrent (KAT)](/1LBr1dHoXvJAMjDgW8Wcg5kbCoKyJnzo6p/): KAT in pre alpha version
   * [Play+](/1J3JSAxiM3uhpkp2dymY59yud8r2RGW6MA/)
   * [Play Anime](/1AnimePihDhcbVdK1nvnbSEtH4oKU8RAYG/): A wide selection of titles from the Anime genre.
   * [Play Movies](/1PLAYgDQboKojowD3kwdb3CtWmWaokXvfp/): A wide selection of titles of various classic genres
   * [TNTvillage Dump](/16xT9VrbbAnWmGEBbA5zZ6HHFZ5nHAgncn/): Italian torrent site dump of TNTVillage
   * [TV Episodes](/tvepisodes.bit/): tvepisodes.bit is a weekly feed of TV episodes.
   * [ZeroTV](/1BEJbnufyav7TK23ADTs2Qi2UJeKSGDzw6/): Download TV Series. (Down/Empty)
   * [ZeroTV mirror](/1HwH4hfRhohJGVtZMBYprYKyHcuJNwL4sZ/)
   * [UA реліз](/1UkrrSpnJmuiig6r5v88Kn3isaR64Fbh3): advanced torrent index with search function
   * [_hot_buttered_toast_](/15wupQiQssL2PnJVZymRRHozeB3w2YfUzv/) searchable list of torrents including peer count
**Torrents :**
   * [Torrent Share](/1ShArE1dJFcHFgTEEAUMXksDZuRckzd3Y)
   * [ZeroTorrent](/192dZ1EG5tU7PnCfuwGMDEBrr2eLqvs4t3)

**Misc :**
   * [ZeroFun(LOL)](/1ZGagD38ypjSoUrpNEGaPFmAMKFcdud7C): upload image or video and share it
   * [The Snowden Files](/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/)
   * [WikiLeaks Torrents](/1BXLnSBQrCamckJfJoTfyyvpYXTvWy6rts/html.zip/wikileaks_torrent.html)

**Music :**
   * [0music.bit](/1MusicXkuN2pk5hRdmroeyaCLDJtzTicpB/): Music file hosting. with a simple UI.
   * [MixTape](/mixtape.bit/): User published library that provides public & private playlists.

# Welcome to ZeroWiki

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform that has been built for the [[ZeroNet]] network.  This wiki is a public, decentralized, and [[cloning|clonable]] site that can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, and sharing knowledge through the creation of [[FAQ]]s, Tutorials, and other documentations. 

You can view the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works, or practice some of your [[markdown]] formatting skills on the Wiki's [[sandbox]] page.

- [[zite|What is a "Zite"?]]

#### Misc:
- [[wallofshame|The Copyright Wall of Shame Community Edition]]
- [[copytrollquotes|A Collection of Quotes by Copyright Trolls]]

#### Useful wikis:
 - [New ZeroWiki](/1LX2wiouHctuUXtu5WkVM9TJJ3YoL6gAfm/) - Clone of ZeroWiki
 - [ZeroTuto, learning resources and tutorials related to ZeroNet](/1Jtjb5CU9aod4jtz8hF5NPPqFKofRSsb4x/)
  
*Please note that [[ZeroWiki]] is still beta software, it may have bugs and lack some features

# Welcome to ZeroWiki

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform that has been build for the [[ZeroNet]] network.  This wiki is a public, decentralized, and [[cloning|clonable]] zite that can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge through the creation of [[FAQ]]s, Tutorials, and other documentations. 

See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works or practice some of your [[markdown]] formatting skills on the Wiki's [[sandbox]] page.

### Getting Started:
- [[zeronet|What is ZeroNet?]]
- [[zite|What is a "Zite"?]]
- [[mute|Muting a user]] 

#### ZeroNet Websites (zites):
- [[zearch| List of Search Engines]] 
- [[List of Zites]]

#### Zeronet Information:
- [[hubs|List of ZeroMe Hubs]]
- [[proxies|List of proxies, allowing you to view ZeroNet from clearnet]]
- [[blocklists|Zeronet Blocklists]] 
- [[zerome|What is ZeroMe?]]

#### ZeroWiki Dev:
- [[ZeroWiki:Format|ZeroWiki writing format]]
- [[Dev ideas|Development ideas]]
- [[markdown|Markdown Formatting Syntax for ZeroWiki and ZeroTalk]]
- [[zerowikisandbox|Sandbox, you can play with it before editing other pages]]

#### Programming/Development:
- [[devresources|List of resources for ZeroNet and Zite development]]

#### Misc:
- [[wallofshame|The Copyright Wall of Shame Community Edition]]
- [[copytrollquotes|A Collection of Quotes by Copyright Trolls]]

#### Useful wikis:
 - [New ZeroWiki](/1LX2wiouHctuUXtu5WkVM9TJJ3YoL6gAfm/) - Clone of ZeroWiki
 - [ZeroTuto, learning resources and tutorials related to ZeroNet](/1Jtjb5CU9aod4jtz8hF5NPPqFKofRSsb4x/)
  
*Please note that [[ZeroWiki]] is still beta software, it may have bugs and lack some features
[[ZeroWiki:Issues|Propose features and report bugs here]].*
```

```
# Muting / Blocking a user
Zeronet offers a many ways of muting a problematic user or website. While Zeronet is a network that promotes the freedom of speech and the preservation of it, you as a Zeronet user have a decision to not be receptive of it. For this reason Zeronet offers a range of methods to mute or block problematic users.

## ZeroTalk:
To mute a user on ZeroTalk, Go to the actual ZeroTalk zite, hover your cursor next to their name, and you should see three black dots. Click the dots, click "mute this user"

## ZeroMe:
In ZeroMe, visit the user's profile page, at the left is a button for muting. 

## Global Mutes:
All of these methods of muting or blocking a user is done so by going to that user's ID provider such as [ZeroID.bit](/zeroid.bit) and click on (search in user database), this will allow you to enter the user's name into the text field. If the text above the button says 'found' you can then go on to click the 'Mute this User' button. 

On some older zeronet instances, there may be a second confirmation dialog will appear in the top right that will ask "Hide all content from...." in which you will need to click the yellow 'Mute' button to confirm the action.

Additionally, there is a video demonstration of the user block and the effect it has on a video platform to block adult material, which can be found on the zeronet [KopyKate Video site](/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1515834496_1J58Rie679DVSuKB1iDyFFTbzmaMaY2bt2).

## Removing a  mute:
One can remove the mute by clicking on the three vertical dots on the [ZeroHello](/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/) page to get a menu. Click on "manage blocked users and sites". Click on the "X" beside their names. 

Users or sites that have been added to a blocklist can only be removed by the site owner.

## Blocklists:
Blocklists are special purpose zeronet sites that contain either users and / or zeronet sites. The sites and users included in these lists will be blocked from your zeronet client. These lists are maintained by the individuals who create them so update frequency may vary dramatically from list to list. Simply visiting a blocklist is not sufficient to enable the blocking feature. One must Enable or Subscribe to that list by ticking the button found on that page.

When the owner of the list adds a new entry, that site will update your local site and your list of blocked users will be updated accordingly. 

__BE ADVISED__ that subscribing to a blocklist is granting great trust into the site owner as they have the ability to block sites and users for a non descriptive purpose and an unaware user would never become aware of the incident unless they unsubscribe from the list themselves.

- A list of [[blocklists]]

## MarkDown Formatting ZeroWiki supports the majority of the markdown formatting subscript. Below you will find a comprehensive list of formatting tags that will help you add style to your ZeroWiki and ZeroTalk contributions. --- ## Headers ``` # H1 ## H2 ### H3 #### H4 ##### H5 ###### H6 Alternatively, for H1 and H2, an underline-ish style: Alt-H1 ====== Alt-H2 ------ ``` # H1 ## H2 ### H3 #### H4 ##### H5 ###### H6 Alternatively, for H1 and H2, an underline-ish style: Alt-H1 ====== Alt-H2 ------ ## Emphasis ``` Emphasis, aka italics, with *asterisks* or _underscores_. Strong emphasis, aka bold, with **asterisks** or __underscores__. Combined emphasis with **asterisks and _underscores_**. Strikethrough uses two tildes. ~~Scratch this.~~ ``` Emphasis, aka italics, with *asterisks* or _underscores_. Strong emphasis, aka bold, with **asterisks** or __underscores__. Combined emphasis with **asterisks and _underscores_**. Strikethrough uses two tildes. ~~Scratch this.~~ ## Lists (In this example, leading and trailing spaces are shown with with dots: ⋅) ``` 1. First ordered list item 2. Another item ⋅⋅* Unordered sub-list. 1. Actual numbers don't matter, just that it's a number ⋅⋅1. Ordered sub-list 4. And another item. ⋅⋅⋅You can have properly indented paragraphs within list items. Notice the blank line above, and the leading spaces (at least one, but we'll use three here to also align the raw Markdown). ⋅⋅⋅To have a line break without a paragraph, you will need to use two trailing spaces.⋅⋅ ⋅⋅⋅Note that this line is separate, but within the same paragraph.⋅⋅ ⋅⋅⋅(This is contrary to the typical GFM line break behaviour, where trailing spaces are not required.) ``` * Unordered list can use asterisks - Or minuses + Or pluses 1. First ordered list item 2. Another item ⋅⋅* Unordered sub-list. 1. Actual numbers don't matter, just that it's a number ⋅⋅1. Ordered sub-list 4. And another item. ⋅⋅⋅You can have properly indented paragraphs within list items. Notice the blank line above, and the leading spaces (at least one, but we'll use three here to also align the raw Markdown). ⋅⋅⋅To have a line break without a paragraph, you will need to use two trailing spaces.⋅⋅ ⋅⋅⋅Note that this line is separate, but within the same paragraph.⋅⋅ ⋅⋅⋅(This is contrary to the typical GFM line break behaviour, where trailing spaces are not required.) * Unordered list can use asterisks - Or minuses + Or pluses ## Links There are two ways to create links. ``` [I'm an inline-style link](https://www.google.com) [I'm an inline-style link with title](https://www.google.com "Google's Homepage") [I'm a reference-style link][Arbitrary case-insensitive reference text] [I'm a relative reference to a repository file](../blob/master/LICENSE) [You can use numbers for reference-style link definitions][1] Or leave it empty and use the [link text itself]. URLs and URLs in angle brackets will automatically get turned into links. http://www.example.com or and sometimes example.com (but not on Github, for example). Some text to show that the reference links can follow later. [arbitrary case-insensitive reference text]: https://www.mozilla.org [1]: http://slashdot.org [link text itself]: http://www.reddit.com ``` [I'm an inline-style link](https://www.google.com) [I'm an inline-style link with title](https://www.google.com "Google's Homepage") [I'm a reference-style link][Arbitrary case-insensitive reference text] [I'm a relative reference to a repository file](../blob/master/LICENSE) [You can use numbers for reference-style link definitions][1] Or leave it empty and use the [link text itself]. URLs and URLs in angle brackets will automatically get turned into links. http://www.example.com or and sometimes example.com (but not on Github, for example). Some text to show that the reference links can follow later. [arbitrary case-insensitive reference text]: https://www.mozilla.org [1]: http://slashdot.org [link text itself]: http://www.reddit.com ## Images ``` Here's our logo (hover to see the title text): Inline-style: ![alt text](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/raw/master/src/common/images/icon48.png "Logo Title Text 1") Reference-style: ![alt text][logo] [logo]: https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/raw/master/src/common/images/icon48.png "Logo Title Text 2" ``` Here's our logo (hover to see the title text): Inline-style: ![alt text](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/raw/master/src/common/images/icon48.png "Logo Title Text 1") Reference-style: ![alt text][logo] [logo]: https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/raw/master/src/common/images/icon48.png "Logo Title Text 2" ## Code and Syntax Highlighting Code blocks are part of the Markdown spec, but syntax highlighting isn't. However, many renderers -- like Github's and Markdown Here -- support syntax highlighting. Which languages are supported and how those language names should be written will vary from renderer to renderer. Markdown Here supports highlighting for dozens of languages (and not-really-languages, like diffs and HTTP headers); to see the complete list, and how to write the language names, see the highlight.js demo page. ``` Inline `code` has `back-ticks around` it. ``` Inline `code` has `back-ticks around` it. Blocks of code are either fenced by lines with three back-ticks ```, or are indented with four spaces. I recommend only using the fenced code blocks -- they're easier and only they support syntax highlighting. ``` ```javascript var s = "JavaScript syntax highlighting"; alert(s); ``` ```python s = "Python syntax highlighting" print s ``` ``` No language indicated, so no syntax highlighting. But let's throw in a tag. ``` ``` ```javascript var s = "JavaScript syntax highlighting"; alert(s); ``` ```python s = "Python syntax highlighting" print s ``` ``` No language indicated, so no syntax highlighting. But let's throw in a tag. ``` ## Tables Tables aren't part of the core Markdown spec, but they are part of GFM and Markdown Here supports them. They are an easy way of adding tables to your email -- a task that would otherwise require copy-pasting from another application. ``` Colons can be used to align columns. | Tables | Are | Cool | | ------------- |:-------------:| -----:| | col 3 is | right-aligned | $1600 | | col 2 is | centered | $12 | | zebra stripes | are neat | $1 | There must be at least 3 dashes separating each header cell. The outer pipes (|) are optional, and you don't need to make the raw Markdown line up prettily. You can also use inline Markdown. Markdown | Less | Pretty --- | --- | --- *Still* | `renders` | **nicely** 1 | 2 | 3 ``` Colons can be used to align columns. | Tables | Are | Cool | | ------------- |:-------------:| -----:| | col 3 is | right-aligned | $1600 | | col 2 is | centered | $12 | | zebra stripes | are neat | $1 | There must be at least 3 dashes separating each header cell. The outer pipes (|) are optional, and you don't need to make the raw Markdown line up prettily. You can also use inline Markdown. Markdown | Less | Pretty --- | --- | --- *Still* | `renders` | **nicely** 1 | 2 | 3 ## Blockquotes ``` > Blockquotes are very handy in email to emulate reply text. > This line is part of the same quote. Quote break. > This is a very long line that will still be quoted properly when it wraps. Oh boy let's keep writing to make sure this is long enough to actually wrap for everyone. Oh, you can *put* **Markdown** into a blockquote. ``` > Blockquotes are very handy in email to emulate reply text. > This line is part of the same quote. Quote break. > This is a very long line that will still be quoted properly when it wraps. Oh boy let's keep writing to make sure this is long enough to actually wrap for everyone. Oh, you can *put* **Markdown** into a blockquote. ## Inline HTML You can also use raw HTML in your Markdown, and it'll mostly work pretty well. ```
Definition list
Is something people use sometimes.
Markdown in HTML
Does *not* work **very** well. Use HTML tags.
```

## Horizontal Rule ``` Three or more... --- Hyphens *** Asterisks ___ ``` Three or more... --- Hyphens *** Asterisks ___ Underscores ## Line Breaks My basic recommendation for learning how line breaks work is to experiment and discover -- hit once (i.e., insert one newline), then hit it twice (i.e., insert two newlines), see what happens. You'll soon learn to get what you want. "Markdown Toggle" is your friend. Here are some things to try out: ``` Here's a line for us to start with. This line is separated from the one above by two newlines, so it will be a *separate paragraph*. This line is also a separate paragraph, but... This line is only separated by a single newline, so it's a separate line in the *same paragraph*. ``` Here's a line for us to start with. This line is separated from the one above by two newlines, so it will be a *separate paragraph*. This line is also a separate paragraph, but... This line is only separated by a single newline, so it's a separate line in the *same paragraph*. ## External links * [Markdown Guide](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet#headers) * [official website](http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/) * [wikipedia entry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown)

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform that has been build for the [[ZeroNet]] network.  This wiki is a public, decentralized, and [[cloning|clonable]] zite that can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge through the creation of [[FAQ]]s, Tutorials, and other documentations. 

See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works or practice some of your [[markdown]] formatting skills on the Wiki's [[zerowikisandbox]] page.

# Muting / Blocking a user
Zeronet offers a many ways of muting a problematic user or website. While Zeronet is a network that promotes the freedom of speech and the preservation of it, you as a Zeronet user have a decision to not be receptive of it. For this reason Zeronet offers a range of methods to mute or block problematic users.

## ZeroTalk:
To mute a user on ZeroTalk, Go to the actual ZeroTalk zite, hover your cursor next to their name, and you should see three black dots. Click the dots, click "mute this user"

## ZeroMe:
In ZeroMe, visit the user's profile page, at the left is a button for muting. 

## Global Mutes:
All of these methods of muting or blocking a user is done so by going to that user's ID provider such as ZeroID and click on (search in user database), this will allow you to enter the user's name into the text field. If the text above the button says 'found' you can then go on to click the 'Mute this User' button. A second confirmation dialog will appear in the top right that will ask "Hide all content from...." in which you will need to click the yellow 'Mute' button to confirm the action.

Additionally, there is a video demonstration of the user block and the effect it has on a video platform to block adult material, which can be found on the zeronet [KopyKate Video site](/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1515834496_1J58Rie679DVSuKB1iDyFFTbzmaMaY2bt2).

## Removing a  mute:
One can remove the mute by clicking on the three vertical dots on the [ZeroHello](/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/) page to get a menu. Click on "manage blocked users and sites". Click on the "X" beside their names. 

Users or sites that have been added to a blocklist can only be removed by the site owner.

## Blocklists:
Blocklists are special purpose zeronet sites that contain either users and / or zeronet sites. The sites and users included in these lists will be blocked from your zeronet client. These lists are maintained by the individuals who create them so update frequency may vary dramatically from list to list. Simply visiting a blocklist is not sufficient to enable the blocking feature. One must Enable or Subscribe to that list by ticking the button found on that page.

When the owner of the list adds a new entry, that site will update your local site and your list of blocked users will be updated accordingly. 

__BE ADVISED__ that subscribing to a blocklist is granting great trust into the site owner as they have the ability to block sites and users for a non descriptive purpose and an unaware user would never become aware of the incident unless they unsubscribe from the list themselves.

- A list of [[blocklists]]

# Blocklists 
Blocklists are special purpose zeronet sites that contain either users and / or zeronet sites. By using the [ContentFilter plugin](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:131), sites and users included in these lists will be blocked from your zeronet client. These lists are maintained by the individuals who create them so update frequency may vary dramatically from list to list. Simply visiting a blocklist is not sufficient to enable the blocking feature. One must Enable or Subscribe to that list by ticking the button found on that page. When the owner of the list adds a new entry, that site will update your local site and your list of blocked users will be updated accordingly.

__BE ADVISED__ that subscribing to a blocklist is granting great trust into the site owner as they have the ability to block sites and users for a non descriptive purpose and an unaware user would never become aware of the incident unless they unsubscribe from the list themselves.

__Alternatively__: if you do not want to use a blocklist but would still want to block or mute a problematic user, you can read the [[mute]] section to learn about other methods of doing so.

Pin / Pinning
=======
Pinning or to Pin a file on Zeronet means that a flag has been placed on a file to ensure that your zeronet client will not remove it.

It prevent a buildup of old files, smaller files will be automatically removed from your client over time. This means that if you share a small file such as a mp3, you may eventually come back later to find that your client is no longer seeding that file which causes you to reacquire it. This can prove problematic in instances where material is no longer available and lacks seeder. To prevent this, a user can 'Pin' a file to ensure that it does expire regardless of seed count or age.

To pin a file, a user must click the [FILES](/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/?Files) tab that is found on the [ZeroHello](/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D) page, from there, a file (or multiple files) can be selected by clicking the left most area of each file. Once files are selected, clicking the PIN button at the top of the page will flag each selected file for preservation.

A file can be identified as being Pinned by the 'pinned' identifier found to the right of the file name. To unpin a file follow the same procedure to pin a file. If there are no files seeded, there will be no files to select on the Files tab.

This can prove problematic in instances where material no longer has available seeds. To prevent this, a user can 'Pin' a file to ensure that it does expire regardless of seed count or age.

To pin a file, a user must click the FILES tab that is found on the ZeroHello page, from there, a file (or multiple files) can be selected by clicking the left most area of each file. Once files are selected, clicking the PIN button at the top of the page will flag each selected file for preservation.

A file can be identified as being Pinned by the 'pinned' identifier found to the right of the file name. To unpin a file follow the same procedure to pin a file. If there are no files seeded, there will be no files to select on the Files tab.

Here is what I did for my headless Ubuntu 19.04 server.

## Install TOR to enable functionality with zeronet.  [Source](https://www.linuxuprising.com/2018/10/how-to-install-and-use-tor-as-proxy-in.html)

 - Start by installing apt-transport-https, needed in order to use https repositories, and curl, to download the repository key:

`sudo apt install apt-transport-https curl`

 - And then add the Tor repository (and its key) in Ubuntu using these commands:

`sudo -i`

`echo "deb https://deb.torproject.org/torproject.org/ $(lsb_release -cs) main" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/tor.list`

`curl https://deb.torproject.org/torproject.org/A3C4F0F979CAA22CDBA8F512EE8CBC9E886DDD89.asc | gpg --import`

`gpg --export A3C4F0F979CAA22CDBA8F512EE8CBC9E886DDD89 | apt-key add -`

`apt update`

`exit`

For Linux Mint, replace `$(lsb_release -cs)` in the first command with the Ubuntu version codename your Linux Mint version is based on. For Linux Mint 19 (and 19.x), use bionic, while for Linux Mint 18.x use xenial.

 - Now you can install Tor, tor-geoipdb (to be able to use country specific exit nodes), torsocks (a library to easily torify applications) and deb.torproject.org-keyring (a package that makes sure you have the latest repository signing key):

`sudo apt install tor tor-geoipdb torsocks`

### Prepare TOR to work with Zeronet,  [Source](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq/#how-to-use-zeronet-with-tor)

 - Open up your /etc/tor/torrc file with

`sudo nano /etc/tor/torrc`

 - Remove the # character from lines `ControlPort 9051` and `CookieAuthentication 1` (line ~57)
    
 - Restart tor, then add permission for yourself to read the auth cookie. With Debian Linux, 

`sudo usermod -a -G debian-tor [yourlinuxuser]`

(be sure to replace [yourlinuxuser] appropriately.)
 - Logout/Login with your user to apply group changes

Tip: You can verify if your Tor setup is running correctly using
`echo 'PROTOCOLINFO' | nc 127.0.0.1 9051`

### Install Zeronet for Debian Linux,  [Source](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/tree/py3#other-platforms-install-from-source)

`sudo apt-get update`

`wget https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet-linux/archive/dist-linux64/ZeroNet-py3-linux64.tar.gz`

`tar xvpfz ZeroNet-py3-linux64.tar.gz`
	
### Enable the Bootstrapper and UIPassword plugins and launch Zeronet

`cd ZeroNet-linux-dist-linux64/`

`cd core`

`cd plugins`

`mv disabled-UiPassword UiPassword`

`mv disabled-Bootstrapper Bootstrapper`

`mv Trayicon disabled-Trayicon`

`cd ..`

`cd ..`

`nohup ./ZeroNet.sh --ui_ip '*' --ui_port 80 --ui_password mypassword`

 - Now you can close your terminal and open your browser to the ip address of your server to see the WebUI.

Notes: 
(ui_ip tells the client to bind the UI to any ip)
(ui_port) being set to 80 is the default port for your browser, you can change it but then you will need to specify the port with the address such as `http://ServerIP:43110` with 43110 being the identified port for the WebUI
(ui_password) this is the password used for your WebUI

## Happy ZeroBoxing!

# Muting / Blocking a user
Zeronet offers a varity of methods to block a user. This method will include a

## ZeroTalk:
To mute a user on ZeroTalk, Go to the actual ZeroTalk zite, hover your cursor next to their name, and you should see three black dots. Click the dots, click "mute this user"

## ZeroME:
In ZeroMe, visit the user's profile page, at the left is a button for muting. 

## Global Mutes:
All of these methods of muting or blocking a user is done so by going to that user's ID provider such as ZeroID and click on (search in user database), this will allow you to enter the user's name into the text field. If the text above the button says 'found' you can then go on to click the 'Mute this User' button. A second confirmation dialog will appear in the top right that will ask "Hide all content from...." in which you will need to click the yellow 'Mute' button to confirm the action.

Additionally, there is a video demonstration of the user block and the effect it has on a video platform to block adult material, which can be found on the zeronet [KopyKate Video site](/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1515834496_1J58Rie679DVSuKB1iDyFFTbzmaMaY2bt2).

## Removing a non Blocklist given mute:
One can remove the mute by clicking on the three vertical dots on the [ZeroHello](/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/) page to get a menu. Click on "manage blocked users and sites". Click on the "X" beside their names.

## Blocklists:
Blocklists are special purpose zeronet sites that contain either users and / or zeronet sites. The sites and users included in these lists will be blocked from your zeronet client. These lists are maintained by the invididuals who create them so update frequency may vary dramatically from list to list. Simply visiting a blocklist is not sufficent to enable the blocking feature. One must Enable or Subscribe to that list by ticking the button found on that page.

When the owner of the list adds a new entry, that site will update your local site and your list of blocked users will be updated accordingly. 

__BE ADVISED__ that subscribing to a blocklist is granting great trust into the site owner as they have the ability to block sites and users for a non descriptive purpose and an unaware user would never become aware of the incident unless they unsubscribe from the list themselves.

- A list of [[blocklists]]

Here is a collection of various file-sharing sites found around ZeroNet. If you don't see one listed here please add it.

The Copyright Wall-Of-Shame === Let this serve as a reminder, that for the 9 out of 10 times the people who make a fuss about morality and ethics, are the same people who don't abide by them, and actually do worse things. This number increases to 10 out of 10 times with anti-piracy collectives, as they have been observed and proven in these past few years of the following. 01. [A Thai police chief and a 'fake copyright agent' being caught extort the parents of a 15 year old Thiland girl](https://torrentfreak.com/copyright-sting-targeting-15-year-old-backfires-with-arrest-warrant-big-sales-191112/) after the girl was instructed to create cartoon faces on baskets after receiving an order for 136 krathong floats only to result in public outcry and the issuing of an arrest warren for the 'fake copyright agent' but no consequence for the police chief who received a portion of the settlement funds from the various of victims. 01. [NBC-Universal making multiple attempts to remove BitTorrent.com from Google search](https://torrentfreak.com/nbcuniversal-repeatedly-flags-bittorrent-com-as-a-pirate-site-190223/) by sending 293 out of the 387 total copyright infringement notices that target the domain. While fortunately for BitTorrent Inc, their domain has not suffered from any down ranking as a result of the false claims, but demonstrates Google's favouritism relating to the intellectual property of mainstream corporations, when it concerns inaccurate, false, and misleading rampant copyright claims, in comparison to independent creators who are given little concern nor representation. 01. UK-based music company De Wolfe Music, using the content monetisation company AdRev Publishing, [to issue a takedown notice against a video that used a music piece from the public domain](https://torrentfreak.com/kenyan-govt-protests-as-national-anthem-hit-with-youtube-copyright-complaint-190206/), titled, ‘Ee Mungu Nguvu Yetu’ (‘O God, of all Creation’)), which was written by the Kenyan Anthem Commission in 1963, to serve as the state anthem. 01. Multiple YouTubers who are expressing their concern that they are receiving copyright strikes for [providing audio clips](https://torrentfreak.com/youtubes-copyright-mess-is-stifling-music-education-190403/) generated that were generated from a midi file or, using [Sport clips](https://torrentfreak.com/youtuber-sends-lawyer-after-ufc-to-stop-unfair-takedown-notices-190517/) within a piece of commentary. Resulting in a response from Youtube that would see the company [forbidding take down claims on short audio clips](https://torrentfreak.com/youtube-forbids-monetizing-short-music-clips-through-manual-content-id-claims-100816/), and even bringing [litigation against a Youtube extortionist](https://torrentfreak.com/youtube-sues-alleged-scammer-over-dmca-extortion-scheme-190920/). 01. Three copyright enforcement lawyers from the Johan Schlüter law firm were [caught swindling almost $16 million, from the MPAA and other Rights holders](https://torrentfreak.com/anti-piracy-lawyers-sentenced-to-years-in-prison-for-defrauding-copyright-holders-180612/) while being employed by the Danish anti-piracy group Antipiratgruppen. And while the trio was ordered to serve prison sentencing which ranged from two to five years, there was the added irony of the trio being free to resume their practice of law upon their release without any additional deterrence. 01. Swedish ISP Bahnhof calling into question [the validity of Swedish judges who have ruled favorable on copyright cases](https://torrentfreak.com/isp-questions-impartiality-of-judges-in-copyright-troll-cases-180602/) while possessing a conflict of interests by maintaining their corporate relations. 01. Adobe [refusing to pay the licensing fees on the sales of their products that contained property of Dolby Laboratories](https://torrentfreak.com/dolby-labs-sues-adobe-for-copyright-infringement-180314/) while also avoiding any requested sales audits after multiple years. As to be expected, the most profitable companies, that will viciously protect their intellectual property at all costs, will also conveniently ignore the same copyright laws when it suits their own benefit and agenda. 01. Copyright enthusiast David Lowery casting criticism at professor Michael Geist over the importance of copyright acknowledgement all [while failing to obtain the proper license on an image shared in his Blog post](https://torrentfreak.com/when-a-pro-copyright-rant-goes-wrong-180225/). All while ignoring the research that has discovered that [many Harvard Lawyers believe that some levels of copyright infringement are ethically acceptable](https://torrentfreak.com/piracy-is-ethically-acceptable-for-many-harvard-lawyers-research-finds-190607/). 01. FlightSimLabs being caught [planting a security exploit named ‘SecurityXploded.Com's ChromePasswordDump v5.5’ into their software](https://torrentfreak.com/flight-sim-company-embeds-malware-to-steal-pirates-passwords-180219/) , which would successfully capture and transmit back to the developer, the stored login credentials of Google Chrome users who were programmatically determined to be using an illegal copy of their software. While this act demonstrated the developers negligent concern towards the security of users in general. it highlights that little consideration was given to the many instances that these browsers would often have stored credentials of family wide households. Preemptively punishing innocent parties as unnamed victims. 01. The company behind the 2015 drama film titled 'Fathers & Daughters' [having their copyright infringement case being dismissed](https://torrentfreak.com/judge-tells-movie-company-that-it-cant-sue-alleged-bittorrent-pirate-180118/) due to the company's exclusive right of ownership to the movie being sold to a company called Vertical Entertainment who were not part of the lawsuit. 01. YouTube allowing multiple RIAA members to claim & monetize videos that contained nothing but [white static noise.](https://torrentfreak.com/musicians-white-noise-youtube-video-hit-with-copyright-complaints-180105/), [a cat's pur](https://torrentfreak.com/youtube-flags-cat-purring-as-copyright-infringing-music-150211/), the [sounds of rainfall](https://torrentfreak.com/youtubes-copyright-protection-system-is-a-total-mess-can-it-be-fixed-181222/), and even a [five minute clip of JFK’s famous “The President and the Press” speech](https://torrentfreak.com/music-distributor-claims-right-to-monetize-jfk-speech-140511/). Illustrating that copyright is fundamentally broken and is only suitable to benefit a very select privileged few. 01. Music copyright advocates using the DMCA and domain seizures to cause irreparable harm to mash up sites like [Sowndhaus](https://torrentfreak.com/could-a-single-copyright-complaint-kill-your-domain-171203/) & [Spinrilla](https://torrentfreak.com/riaa-labels-sue-hip-hop-mixtape-download-site-spinrilla-170206/) by taking action of litigation without ever notifying the website owners of the [claim of infringement](https://torrentfreak.com/piracy-riaa-labels-asked-us-to-promote-their-music-spinrilla-says-170316/). 01. Epic Games' [taking aggressive judicial action against a 14 year old Fortnite cheater](https://torrentfreak.com/mom-defends-14-year-old-fortnite-cheater-in-court-171125/) over the usage of an online game cheat and multiple free accounts registered with fake email addresses with claims of copyright infringement as their means of halting cheaters. Demonstrating that copyright litigation is often the litigious tool of choice with [little consideration for those](https://torrentfreak.com/cheating-fortnite-kid-wants-copyright-lawsuit-dismissed-190807/) who may be targeted. 01. ABC, AOL, CBS Broadcasting, NBCUniversal, NPR, Time, Viacom, Warner Bros, Yahoo and Ziff Davi [settling with numerous photographers due to infringing use of their photographs](https://torrentfreak.com/pirating-mainstream-media-outlets-haunted-by-photographers-in-court-171028/) found throughout their News & Blog articles. In which CBS later [counter sue due to a Gunsmoke screen shot being posted on social media](https://torrentfreak.com/cbs-sues-man-for-posting-image-of-a-59-year-tv-show-on-social-media-171030/) in an attempt to reduce their damage settlement. Demonstrating that not even those who actively litigate copyright law don't bare any respect for it. 01. New Zealand's ruling National Party being [forced to pay $600k for infringing the copyrights of Eminem's track "Lose Yourself" due to using a derivative song with a similar melody for their campaign ad](https://torrentfreak.com/lose-yourself-national-party-guilty-of-eminem-copyright-infringement-171025/) demonstrating that even when obtaining proper licenses will not prevent a copyright related lawsuit. 01. Four officials of the Russian site-blocking body [Rozcomnadzor, {including spokesman, top lawyer, and Anastasiya Zvyagintseva} being charged with fraud](https://torrentfreak.com/russian-site-blocking-chiefs-under-investigation-for-fraud-171024/) and stand accused of having 'employed' ghost staff whose salaries were actually paid to existing employees, on top of their own money all while being allowed to block 4,000 sites on copyright grounds with an additional 41,000 innocent websites blocked as collateral damage demonstrating that copyright law often leaves a trail of harm rather than any potential good. 01. Game developer [Atlus targeting the Patreon page of the RPCS3 {Playstation 3} emulator with a DMCA takedown notice](https://torrentfreak.com/of-course-atlus-hit-rpcs3s-patreon-page-over-persona-5-170927/) due to a comment which stated that Atlus' game title Persona 5 will be compatible with the RPCS3 emulator, which resulted in an intimidation tactic that persuaded the RPCS3 development team to remove all occurrences of the compatibility reference from their Patreon and other pages while Atlus admits that the RPCS3 team has done nothing wrong nor infringed on any of their rights. Illustrating that abusive claims of copyright infringement are often made without hesitance. 01. Sega attempting to trick Steam users [by sneaking Denuvo into their Sonic Mania release by not specifying the third party DRM EULA on the store front page](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/sonic-mania-pcs-drm-angers-players-sega-adds-offli/1100-6452993/) while the game was on pre-order and also handing out [a 'free' emulated Sonic the Hedgehog Sega Genesis/Mega Drive game](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/four-days-before-release-sonic-mania-pc-delayed-bu/1100-6452474/) to hinder the [issuance of refunds](http://store.steampowered.com/steam_refunds). 01. Media giant [ABS-CBN using the judiciary favor of a Florida Federal court to establish a $1.8 million dollar settlement from the operator of KissAsian,ch who is likely not a US citizen.](https://torrentfreak.com/florida-court-orders-pirate-site-kissasian-to-pay-1-8m-in-damages-170825/) Allowing much needed US resources to be devoted to foreign parties regarding their foreign affairs. 01. The [RIAA refusing to give accreditation to their musical artists and piece composers](https://torrentfreak.com/riaa-says-artists-dont-need-moral-rights-artists-disagree-170521/) with the refusal reason of ['it would be "complex" to always attribute writers for their work".](https://torrentfreak.com/artists-protest-riaa-for-trampling-on-their-moral-rights-170817/) 01. Flava Works [attempting to extort huge sums of cash {$97,000 – $525,000} from WE,tv's President & General Manager Marc Juris with threats of exposing his sexual preference to the public](https://torrentfreak.com/public-figure-threatened-with-exposure-over-gay-piracy-fine-170817/) in the event of failure to pay. Which, once again, illustrating that copyright enforcers are often worse than the most hardened of criminals. 01. The Anti-Ad-Blocking company [Admiral submitting a DMCA removal notice to the EasyList {ad-blocker definition} Github repository with the goal of having the Ad Server URl entry 'functionalclam.com^$third-party' removed from the list.](https://torrentfreak.com/dmca-used-to-remove-ad-server-url-from-easylist-ad-blocklist-170811/) Creating a slippery slope for future removals. 01. Copyright extortionists manipulation of the courts, led by Kerry Culpeppe and using intimidation tactics to accuse a [72 year old man](https://torrentfreak.com/72-year-old-man-accused-of-pirating-over-a-thousand-torrents-170810/), a [Texan woman](https://torrentfreak.com/copyright-troll-claims-texan-woman-downloaded-over-54000-torrents-170713/), and [others](https://torrentfreak.com/86-year-old-grandma-accused-of-pirating-a-zombie-game-161031/) of mass infringement. 01. Telecom giant's Dish Network, Bell Canada, TVA, Videotron, and Rogers abuse of the judicial system with the goals of [shutting down TVAddons and intimidating Canadian resident Adam Lackman by allowing private agencies to seize control of the platform and equipment](https://torrentfreak.com/tvaddons-returns-ugly-war-canadian-telcos-kodi-addons-170801/) without any chance of legal representation or any real sense of justice or due process for the site operator. {Those who wish to show support can do so [[here](https://www.generosity.com/community-fundraising/tvaddons-legal-defense-fund)]} 01. The [RIAA making attempts to bring litigation against Cloudflare concerning numerous MP3Skull domains in an attempt to illustrate to the courts that Cloudflare is facilitating the activities of controversial sites](https://torrentfreak.com/cloudflare-asks-court-to-vacate-moot-pirate-site-blocking-order-170724/), regardless that the domains were owned by Sony Music Entertainment, who is an RIAA member. 01. [The Daily Mail willfully infringing copyrights and using unlicensed viral YouTube videos to promote their articles](https://torrentfreak.com/daily-mail-sued-for-pirating-dozens-of-viral-videos-170711/). Highlighting that companies will ignore the copyrights of others when there is a financial return. 01. The US State Department, MPAA, and RIAA [asking Stanford University students to propagate a fake Twitter feud in an attempt to facilitate these agencies anti-piracy goals](https://torrentfreak.com/state-dept-mpaa-riaa-fake-twitter-feud-plan-backfires-170706/#disqus_thread) and using Benjamin Franklin, who conversely was an advocate of sharing, as their reference. 01. [The Premier League carelessly making attempts to remove Facebook.com from Google search](https://torrentfreak.com/premier-league-asks-google-to-take-down-facebooks-homepage-170429/) on the accusations of facilitating the infringement of their intellectual property, which should give grave concern over the recent [Notice-&-Staydown](https://torrentfreak.com/takedown-staydown-would-be-a-disaster-internet-archive-warns-160607/) proposals. 01. The [AEPI being caught swindling over 42.5 million euros from artists while top executives payed themselves over nearly five million euros between them](https://torrentfreak.com/huge-scandal-engulfs-greek-anti-piracy-royalties-group-170318/). After receiving a fine of 35 million euros, 7.5 million euros is left uncounted and leaving the orchestrator's of such schemes unaccountable. 01. ## Site Templates

1. [[ZeroTemplate]]

     ZeroTemplate is a template for creating and developing ZeroNet sites. It provides an easy way to develop advanced ZeroNet sites with NPM dependencies and automatic building and releasing.

2.  [Kopi](/1KtzUsnmwc1Wr7KWWEGnWzmBSQoyH917Pz) 

    Kopi is a ZeroNet boilerplate with all the necessary elements to start a new project without the need to configure and develop the same features again and again.

3. [ZeroNetTemplate](https://github.com/anoadragon453/ZeroNetTemplate)

   Site template for making ZeroNet sites with modern web technologies.

4. [Zeronet/React example site](https://github.com/rllola/zeronet-react)

    Get started creating a ZeroNet site using React. Need to be updated.

5. [Zeronet in the Eyes of the Media/Timeline example site](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NEwsvyrAoEWU64ZozwdfgEUQhwxiCrh1t)

## Dev Tools

1. [[ZeroFrameJS|ZeroFrame WebSocket API for JavaScript]]

    This is JavaScript WebSocket client for ZeroFrame API. It supports (almost) same features as default ZeroFrame that is included in ZeroNet sites, but it is using WebSocket client so it can be used in local programs, such as Node.js and Electron. It can't be used in browsers because of CORS restrictions.

1. [[ZeroFramePy|ZeroFrame WebSocket API for Python]]

    This is Python WebSocket client for ZeroFrame API. It supports (almost) same features as default ZeroFrame that is included in ZeroNet sites, but it is using WebSocket client so it can be used in local programs.

2.  [ZeroDevLib](https://github.com/imachug/ZeroDevLib)

    Libraries for ZeroNet site development.

3. [Zeroframe on NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/zeroframe)

4.  [ZeroFrame Router](/1K2myjtjoEVpRC2JMieRL73ES4V4iLP2Ev/?/) #vue.js

    A very basic router that works with the ZeroFrame API.

5. [Mavo](/1F6Rt2QNMA6uJTSTZkDNBfXTd3unrtgcdJ/) #official #experimental

     ZeroNet storage plugin for Mavo that allows any web application created for this platform to run in a P2P and decentralized way without any modification. [[ref]](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:113:ZeroNet+backed+for+Mavo)

6.  [zeronet-websocket](/1JKPBG3dLp9FARyarPoR3Mv3p5d9Fy9Em1)

    Nodejs websocket wrapper for ZeroFrame API

7.  [ZeroNet-cmd-lib](https://github.com/imachug/ZeroNet-cmd-lib)

    Python websocket wrapper for ZeroFrame API, command-line tools for ZeroNet and some ZeroNet sites.

Here is what I did for my headless Ubuntu 19.04 server.

## Install TOR to enable functionality with zeronet.  [Source](https://www.linuxuprising.com/2018/10/how-to-install-and-use-tor-as-proxy-in.html)

 - Start by installing apt-transport-https, needed in order to use https repositories, and curl, to download the repository key:

`sudo apt install apt-transport-https curl`

 - And then add the Tor repository (and its key) in Ubuntu using these commands:

`sudo -i`

`echo "deb https://deb.torproject.org/torproject.org/ $(lsb_release -cs) main" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/tor.list`

`curl https://deb.torproject.org/torproject.org/A3C4F0F979CAA22CDBA8F512EE8CBC9E886DDD89.asc | gpg --import`

`gpg --export A3C4F0F979CAA22CDBA8F512EE8CBC9E886DDD89 | apt-key add -`

`apt update`

`exit`

For Linux Mint, replace `$(lsb_release -cs)` in the first command with the Ubuntu version codename your Linux Mint version is based on. For Linux Mint 19 (and 19.x), use bionic, while for Linux Mint 18.x use xenial.

 - Now you can install Tor, tor-geoipdb (to be able to use country specific exit nodes), torsocks (a library to easily torify applications) and deb.torproject.org-keyring (a package that makes sure you have the latest repository signing key):

`sudo apt install tor tor-geoipdb torsocks deb.torproject.org-keyring`

### Prepare TOR to work with Zeronet,  [Source](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq/#how-to-use-zeronet-with-tor)

 - Open up your /etc/tor/torrc file with

`sudo nano /etc/tor/torrc`

 - Remove the # character from lines `ControlPort 9051` and `CookieAuthentication 1` (line ~57)
    
 - Restart tor, then add permission for yourself to read the auth cookie. With Debian Linux, 

`sudo usermod -a -G debian-tor [yourlinuxuser]`

(be sure to replace [yourlinuxuser] appropriately.)
 - Logout/Login with your user to apply group changes

Tip: You can verify if your Tor setup is running correctly using
`echo 'PROTOCOLINFO' | nc 127.0.0.1 9051`

### Install Zeronet for Debian Linux,  [Source](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/tree/py3#other-platforms-install-from-source)

`sudo apt-get update`
`wget https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet-linux/archive/dist-linux64/ZeroNet-py3-linux64.tar.gz`
`tar xvpfz ZeroNet-py3-linux64.tar.gz`
	
### Enable the Bootstrapper and UIPassword plugins and launch Zeronet

`cd ZeroNet-linux-dist-linux64/`

`cd core`

`cd plugins`

`mv disabled-UiPassword UiPassword`

`mv disabled-Bootstrapper Bootstrapper`

`cd ..`

`cd ..`

`nohup ./ZeroNet.sh --ui_ip '*' --ui_port 80 --ui_password mypassword`

 - Now you can close your terminal and open your browser to the ip address of your server to see the WebUI.

Notes: 
(ui_ip tells the client to bind the UI to any ip)
(ui_port) being set to 80 is the default port for your browser, you can change it but then you will need to specify the port with the address such as `http://ServerIP:43110` with 43110 being the identified port for the WebUI
(ui_password) this is the password used for your WebUI
